title: Mukti Rehabilitation Centre
detailsOfAchievement: Mukti is a social organization working for the marginalized sections of the society since 2002. We are at present running five programs. 1. Rehabilitation Program(Residential) for Solvent Addicted Children 2. De-addiction Program(Residential) 3. Outreach Program at Sealdah Railway Station 4. Educational Program at Chengail for Child Domestic Workers 5. Computer Literacy Program at Rajarhat In addition we also organize awareness programs on health and education in association with schools and industry bodies like CII and Bengal Chamber of Commerce and Industry. To the best of our knowledge, we are the only NGO which provides a single umbrella rehabilitation program for the marginalized kids, including those who are referred to as platform kids. With doctors in attendance round the clock, probably the only NGO in Kolkata to offer such an all inclusive facility, the kids are groomed, tutored, schooled and vocationally trained for effective reintegration into the mainstream. Our rehabilitation program for street and platform children which was catering to 15 boys last year has been extended to cater to 25 boys this year (2015-16) . The effectiveness of program has been evident in the fact that the Child Welfare Committee (Constituted under the Juvenile Justice Act 2000) in various districts continued to repose their faith on us and sent children in need of De-addiction, care and protection to us. At present 14 boys are attending Apeejay School, Salt Lake(7 in the formal section and 7 in the non formal section) while 7 older boys are in Vocational training. The entire process is geared towards reintegrating the children back into the mainstream of the society and giving them back the rights that they have been denied. The emphasis is on Education and Skills Development through which the children become independent adults. The aim is to see children having nowhere to go and nobody, turning into young adults with somewhere to go and somebody with their own identities and leading independent lives . We have all the required sanctions, including exemption under Sec 80G of I.Tax and mental health license.

detailsOfAchievement: Since its inception, the Society has been working towards the holistic development, mainly of the local area. Being a rural area, the locality of registration of the Society suffers from lack of infrastructure in different sectors. The Society generally attempts to address such issues. The Society engages itself in organizing events of socio-cultural significance in the local area like the following - 1. Observing Independence day, Republic Day, Birthdays of Rabindranath tagore, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, etc. 2. Organizing blood donation and free medical check up camps 3. Organizing events and competitions for local students in various cultural sectors. 4. Arranging for commencement and development of a students library that is lacking in the local area till date.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: This organisation has been run by local people,mainly from the younger generation ,who themselves contribute in the sources of Donation and subscription .This has always been the main source of our funds ever since the inception of the society.Other approximate details of fund sources are as follows-1.Donation and Subscriptions from local members and well wishers . 2.Amount sanctioned by Govt. of West Bengal on account of Creation of Sports infrastructure and Durable Sports Assets.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The organization has been engaged primarily in the sanitation as well as health and hygiene during this stipulated period. The emphasis was also given on vocational training programs as well as exposing the orthodox agricultural sector to advance scientific method of farming. further stress was also given on the campaigning of the welfare of the womenfolk, as well as for the importance of education.

This organization has been solely involved in the social activities. The organization campaigned for well being of the womenfolk as well as spreading the benefits of education. Sanitation programmes were also conducted with the help of grants derived from the local government.

To work for sustainable development practises in the rural areas ensuring women empowerment at all stages. Making people aware of the rights, duties, and responsibilities as an individual. A villager, a citizen. Providing preventive, primitive and curative health care services for the people in general and women and children in specific, Empowering the rural women through micro-finance and micro entrepreneurship development programme Imparting vocational training for rural youth.

The camp consists of 54 children, who were withdrawn from Child Labour. The programme is specifically aimed at reducing Child Labour from the society.

detailsOfAchievement: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF COMPUTER STUDIES (NICS), started from the year 2014, is an ISO 9001: 2008 certified body. I.T Industry was at the boom but scarcity of I.T. Skilled professional was a major problem that time, there were hardly any Hardware institute in the Country. It was then, that NICS-Education Group thought of using their Long Software and Hardware experience to open a Software and hardware training institute. Gradually NICS spread its wings by means of Franchisee throughout India VISSION OF MISSION NICS :A mission for Inclusion of physically & Economically disable persons in main stream of the society by self-dependable technical & vocational education. OUR MAIN FEATURES : To the unemployment problem by providing job oriented education to meet the requirement of industry.To give quality education by creating a dedicated and skilled team of Faculty.To continuously create a system of giving maximum training at minimum cost. To empower the youth of average merit by training them towards a successful career. To provide vocational training, specific to the skill and interest of each student.To provide Vocational Training, specific to the skill and interest of each student. AT A GLANCE : NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF COMPUTER STUDIES, NICS is a mass level Computer education mission which is encouraged by the objectives of National Computer Literacy Programme IT, Govt. of India and initiated by NICS Education having its Registered Office in Coochbehar West Bengal Pin:- 736131. Other than being a Company / Firm / Society NICS is a project of NICS Education. Thus all the Affiliations and Credentials belong to NICS education and associated with its Registered Office only. We are sure our students can meet any demand & challenges that the employer may have on them. I wish them great success in all their endeavours and quest for a better tomorrow, for themselves and for the mankind

title: NATRANGA
detailsOfAchievement: In action since the second day of October 1972, we, as a group theatre organization are playing our role in the theatre movement through our productions and in the process serving the cause of social awareness and entertainment. Till date we have staged 25 full-length and 11 short plays in different stages across the country. Productions like, Sadhabar Ekadoshi, Fazal Ali Ashchay, Kabayah, Dibanishi, Ganatantrer Naam Jabonika, Dwidhakaal , Megapode, "Gulbaj- The Man Of The Match", "Aami Weds Aami", "Snuopoka", etc., have successfully earned a note of distinction and appreciation from the theatre lovers of the country. Right now we are in the process of regularly staging a sensational fantasy, Beokuf Ek Chaand. It has earned extreme repute from the audience and numerous houseful shows do prove a point to it. Recent productions like GULBAJ- THE MAN OF THE MATCH, SNUOPOKA and AAMI WEDS AAMI are also rocking the Bengali stage along with BEOKUF EK CHAAND.

detailsOfAchievement: Nature Environment & Wildlife Society is committed to protect and conserve wildlife ecology and environment since more than a decade NEWS is also committed to engage people in alternative and sustainable livelihood those who are mainly dependent on threatened ecosystems and to enrich their participation in the conservation process The organization simultaneously aims at creating awareness among the masses to fulfill the mission of conservation NEWS is a registered non-profit organization, funded by a wide range of Indian and International donors From a small beginning initially in the year 1991 it has been slowly but steadily growing as a research based organization in Kolkata to cater the complex need of biodiversity conservation and village people socio economic up gradation Our publications on environment and wildlife are well documented NEWS is publishing a quarterly journal ENVIRON on environmental issues science 1993 NEWS works in collaboration with the state government to conserve and protect the natural resources and wildlife by conducting several research projects and training programmes organized periodically followed up every year respectively NEWS has conducted various Wildlife Conservation Projects with species that are of highest concern such as Bengal Tiger Clouded Leopard Hodgson Flying Squirrel Himalayan Newt Bengal Folican Indian Pangolin Gangetic Dolphin Estuarine Crocodile Olive Ridley Turtle Indian Wolf Lesser Cats species turtle species and amphibian species in the landscape of North Bengal as well as South Bengal mainly comprises of Sundarban area NEWS has also carrying out other conservation and livelihood projects respectively such as Impact assessment of changes in water use and water quality on aquatic flora of east Kolkata zone prepared a manual on life size foot print with necessary parameters of Indian mammals Livelihood projects conducted in Sundarban Mangrove restoration project through community participation Benchmark studies on status of Sundarban Mangrove forests Livestock up gradation project in Buxa Tiger Reserve and many more NEWS also building resilience of the coastal communities of Bhitarakanika Odisha through increased livelihood security at Dangamal and Khamarasahi village in Dangamal Gram Panchayat Rajnagar Block Kendrapara District Odisha The main objectives title: NATYA SHODH SANSTHAN
detailsOfAchievement: On 19th July,1981, Natya Shodh Sansthan began its journey as a theatre archive from 11 Pretoria Street, Kolkata, as a unit of Upchar Trust with Geeta Sen rendition of Bangla theatre songs as the inaugural programme. Theatre lovers of the city and outside were gradually becoming aware of the meaningful job being done there. At Lee Road, Sansthan housed books, magazines, audio and video recordings, photographs, models of outstanding sets, masks, rare books and materials, Seminars, discussions and talks were regularly organized to record various aspects of histrionics on a pan-Indian level. Sansthans journey reached a milestone when the Government of West Bengal leased 9 cottahs of land to Upchar Trust where Sansthan built Natya Bhavan to continue its activities. In 1996,Girish Karnad, the noted playwright and actor laid the foundation stone of Natya Bhavan. Sri Buddhadev Bhattacharjee, the then Deputy Chief Minister, Govt. of West Bengal inaugurated the new building in 2000, constructed with financial aid from Upchar Trust, the Government of India, Government of West Bengal, Ford Foundation, Trusts and individuals. The year 2006 saw the Sansthan celebrating its Silver Jubilee and the institution has since then moved on to gradually become a research and information centre, documenting the growth and present trends of Indian theatre. Sections in the Archive- 1. Library and Cover-file (Records) with reading room facilities, 2. Audio Library, 3. Video Library, 4. Photograph Library, 5. Research and Publication Section. Heritage Library - Sansthan has set up a Heritage Library, based on the premise that theatre-studies need to be located in the broader canvas of the heritage/history of multiple disciplines of Anthropology, Astronomy, Astrology, Archaeology, Architecture, Culture, Geo-politics, Geography History, Literature, Philosophy, Religion, Sociology, the Arts, both visual and performing etc. With cultural-history being regarded as a rich source of understanding the heritage and the cultural tradition of a country, materials stored in an archive may be made use of in the fullest possible way from a spectators point of view. The Sansthan is setting up a Theatre Museum at Natya Bhavan with financial aid from the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, Under the Museum Grant Scheme.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Sansthan has begun working on building a Heritage Library at Natya Bhavan to house specialized books on several subjects that would enable a reader to study the heritage of various subjects, cultures and arts. To have a thread-bare discussions on the subject, Sansthan had arranged for this 3-day Round Table discussion.

The archives/museum of Sansthan contains varied collections in the form of Print, Materials, Photographs, Audio-cassettes and CDs in the audio section, VHS and DVDs in the video section, Sets models of well-known plays, Masks, Weapons, Ornaments etc. The aim of the project is to set up a "Theater Museum" with the materials stored which would showcase the evolution of Indian Theater through 3 galleries- Sanskrit, Folk and contemporary theater, with detailed documentation.

title: Natyanova Performing Arts Centre
detailsOfAchievement: Natyanova Performing Arts Centre is an institution dedicated to performing, teaching and researching in the field of Art and Culture. Apart from being a leading repertory of Mohiniyattam and Bharatanatyam, Natyanova also extends itself to imparting knowledge of performance through lecture demonstrations and workshops to the under privileged sections of the society through government schools and teaching some students free of charge for inclusion into their repertory. Looking at performance as a system of Yoga is also an important component in their training system. They have performed both Nationally and internationally in many prestigious venues and festivals. Some important performances include: Inaugural production of Hiranyagarbha, collating Yoga and Dance. Production of Usha based on Rg Vedic shlokas of Ratri and Usha. Ardhanarishwar based on the dualities of life based on the Sankhya philosophy of Shiva and Shakti. Productions on philosophy of life based on works of Tagore, Amar Mukti Aloye Aloye and Nagar Lakshmi for the 150 years of Tagore. Their performances include Festivals like Uday Shankar festival of the West Bengal Govt. Nrityasanrachana festival organised by the Sangeet Natak Academy, Sangam festival Bhubaneshwar, Pravaha festival of IRCEN, EZCC festival, ICCR Horizon series, India Trade Fair festival and the most recent ABU International Dance festival of DD. They also perform free for philanthropic causes like performance for the Welfare Society for the Blind. They have worked extensively at Bankura District with Shamayita Math. They have been on an ICCR tour to Eastern European Countries also. They hope to slowly increase their work and include many dancers from the schools serving the under priviledged sections of the society.

detailsOfAchievement: Navoday Society started with the intention of providing free medical tests and consultation to the poor and the needy and since 2005 we have provided free medical services, consultation and investigations not only to patients of Kolkata and adjoining areas but also to patients as far as Bankura district (Jangalmahal) and Sundarban. We hold free camps regularly within Kolkata and thus far we have served over 1500 patients. We have also been associated with a few other charitable organisations like Dakhineshwar Ramkrishna Sangha Adayapith Behala Branch, Lions Club and Arjyo Samiti in Behala, where we have participated in similar medical camps. Our vision is to provide and support the poor and the down trodden in whichever way we can, including providing medical and dental services, shelter and food and in extremely difficult situation to extend financial help as well. We are also involved on an ongoing project of Road Safety Awareness in Kolkata. We have recently been certified for exemption u/s 80G of the Income Tax Act.

title: NAYENATUA
detailsOfAchievement: The troupe Naye Natua is laden with as many as 30 young talented actors including casual and regular who are working tirelessly throughout the year. Naye Natua, a new fledged theatre troupe of Kolkata aspires to take its flight with many ambitious productions ranging from fairy tales to the modern immortal fictions of Bengal and India at large. Geared with a determination to explore the untrodden region of Indian Theatre with newer perceptions of our Time and Space, Naye Natua sets forth with a batch of real fresher guided by the able veterans to stage its performances. The troupe has already performed and wholeheartedly praised by connoisseurs in Kolkata, West Bengal, Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Assam, Hyderabad, Toronto and many other places. Presently Naye Natua is performing Michael Madhusudan Dutts Meghnad Bodh Kabya, Famous Indian story writer Premchands Bare Bhai Sahab as Borda Borda along with contemporary theatre like Missed Call written by Debshankar Halder. The themes encompass varied subjects from modern social tribulations to deep rooted family values, epic and undying pain. Under the direction of our house director Goutam Halder we can produce three new productions this year. We have great interest in producing theatre for children too. New productions: This year the troupe has decided to stage three productions under the direction of our house director Goutam Halder. Extensive discussions are going on regarding Bengali author Shirshendu Mukherjees Jaal, Amake Dekhun, Jama Kharoch; Rabindranath Tagores poems like Horikhela,Dui Pakhi; play Baikunther Khata etc. We have started planning regarding a musical production emerging from poems. A theatrical performance suffused with the poetry as text of theatre, and of acting with idioms of movement, dance, songs and music  in short, a production with coexistence of physicality, visuality and musicality. We are in search of a new performance style of theatre which is far from conventional forms of theatre; a theatre with the vibrant presence of actors with great potential for dance and music. The text will be a composite a bunch of lyrics in a composite bouquet chosen from popular folk songs, poems from Rabindranath Tagore, Satyajit Ray, Joy Goswami, Satyendranath Dutta, Buddhadeb Basu, Shakti Chottopadhyay, Premendra Mitra and others. The participants of the in-house training programme will be included in these productions. The troupe is organizing workshops in association with other organizations like Minerva, Anyo theatre, Jadavpur University, Cultivation of Science, Happenings, Canada Bengali Club and many others. These workshops encompass all aspects regarding in-depth study and intense theatre training. Exploration of new theatre language for enriching the style of production along with the meaningful application of other allied art forms and its vitality and viability in present day situation.
